sn22.91:4.2: Then Venerable Rāhula went up to the Buddha,
sn22.91:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn22.91:4.5: “Sir, how does one know and see so that there’s no ego, possessiveness, or tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli?”
sn22.91:5.1: “Rāhula, one truly understands any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all form—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.91:5.2: One truly understands any kind of feeling …
sn22.91:5.5: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all form—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.91:5.7: That’s how to know and see so that there’s no ego, possessiveness, or tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli.”
